description:
Commodity groups (Classification of Food and Industrial
Products (EGW) 2002: 1-digit codes)

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
51000 Foreign trade

Definition:
The EGW Classification of Food and Industrial Products
(commodity groups and subgroups) is a national commodity
classification, which sub-classifies products by their
origin into food products and industrial products.

Changes over time:
Between 1936 and 2001, the Classification remained
unchanged. As of 1 January 2002, a revised version has been
available to take account of current economic and
technological developments. As a result, however, there have
been unavoidable breaks in the long time series.

name: Commodity groups (EGW 2002: 1-digit codes)
